content.raw:
Thank you for the interest in Gazebo and SDFormat.

Gazebo is a robot simulator, while SDFormat is a format used to describe simulations. Gazebo uses SDFormat to describe the simulations it's going to run, so Gazebo depends on SDF. But SDF is independent of Gazebo and is used by other projects as well.

I suggest you go through some Gazebo tutorials to get familiar with its components:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=components&cat=get_started

And aso take a look at the SDFormat website:

http://sdformat.org/

Also, feel free to direct any questions related to Gazebo and SDF to the Gazebo Answers website:

http://answers.gazebosim.org/

This issue tracker is specifically for bug reports and feature requests related to SDF.

Have fun!

content.raw: Not an issue or a feature request.
